org.fluidity.foundation

Interface Configuration.Query<R,P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - the settings interface type passed to the run() method.
    R - the return type of the run() method.
    Enclosing interface:
    Configuration<T>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface Configuration.Query<R,P>
    Groups configuration queries to provide settings consistency. Properties read in the read() method will be consistent in that no property change will take place during the execution of that method. Stashing the read method parameter and invoking its methods outside the read method will not have the same effect.

    This feature is subject to property provider support.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   MyComponent(final Configuration<MySettings> configuration) {
     final int data = configuration.query(new Configuration.Query<MySettings, Integer>() {
       public final Integer read(final MySettings settings) {
         return settings.property1() + settings.property2();
       }
     });

     …
   }

   interface MySettings {

       @Configuration.Property(key = "property1", undefined = "default value 1")
       int property1();

       @Configuration.Property(key = "property2", undefined = "default value 2")
       int property2();
   }
 }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      R run(P settings)
      Atomic access to the settings.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        R run(P settings)
throws Exception
        Atomic access to the settings. If the underlying PropertyProvider supports it, properties will not be updated dynamically while this method executes. However, stashing the method parameter and invoking its methods outside this method will circumvent consistency afforded to property access within the method.
        Parameters:
        settings - an object implementing the settings interface.
        Returns:
        whatever the caller wants Configuration.query() returned.
        Throws:
        Exception - when some error occurs.
